text:
how do you programatically assign column names
```cname = "DOSE"
DataFrame(Symbol(cname) = 1)```
I want the dataframe to have the column name that I stored in the variable cname.

elements.text: how do you programatically assign column names
I want the dataframe to have the column name that I stored in the variable cname.

text:
You use ` => ` for working with keyword arguments programmatically

```DataFrame(Symbol(cname) => 1)```

elements.text: You use ` => ` for working with keyword arguments programmatically

text:
seems like I can't do this?

```cname = "DOSE"
DataFrame(Symbol(cname) => 1, b=1)```

elements.text: seems like I can't do this?

text: no, you can't do that. You can't mix the two forms of keyword arguments.

elements.text: no, you can't do that. You can't mix the two forms of keyword arguments.

text:
To be more precise `b=1` is a keyword argument while `:b => 1` would be a positional argument. You have to choose and either use one or the other. Otherwise there would be a problem like this:
```julia> f(args...; kwargs...) = (args..., kwargs...)
f (generic function with 1 method)

julia> f(a=1, :b => 2, c=3, :d => 4)
(:b => 2, :d => 4, :a => 1, :c => 3)```

elements.text: would be a positional argument. You have to choose and either use one or the other. Otherwise there would be a problem like this:

julia> f(args...; kwargs...) = (args..., kwargs...)
f (generic function with 1 method)

julia> f(a=1, :b => 2, c=3, :d => 4)
(:b => 2, :d => 4, :a => 1, :c => 3)

text: You could also just apply the column names later through `rename!(df, cnames)`

elements.text: You could also just apply the column names later through
